section_id: ## 4. The Environment: State and Reward Measurement

hints.label: def-reward-measurement
hints.title: Reward Measurement
hints.content:
1109: :label: def-reward-measurement
1110: The reward value $r_i$ for walker $i$ at position $x_i$ is the result of integrating the global Reward Function $R$ against the walker's **positional measure**, which is the Dirac delta measure $\delta_{x_i}$ on $\mathcal{X}$.
1111: $$
1112: r_i := \mathbb{E}_{\delta_{x_i}}[R] = \int_{\mathcal{X}} R(x) \, d\delta_{x_i}(x) = R(x_i)
1113: $$
hints.section: ## 4. The Environment: State and Reward Measurement
hints.raw_directive:
1107: A walker determines the value of its location by evaluating the global Reward Function.
1108: :::{prf:definition} Reward Measurement
1109: :label: def-reward-measurement
1110: The reward value $r_i$ for walker $i$ at position $x_i$ is the result of integrating the global Reward Function $R$ against the walker's **positional measure**, which is the Dirac delta measure $\delta_{x_i}$ on $\mathcal{X}$.
1111: $$
1112: r_i := \mathbb{E}_{\delta_{x_i}}[R] = \int_{\mathcal{X}} R(x) \, d\delta_{x_i}(x) = R(x_i)
1113: $$
1114: This formalizes the act of "evaluating the reward" as a measurement process.
